page.title: 09Codsall Fire Station
page.content: The Station, on Duck Lane, is 15 years old and houses one engine which is nine years old. It is a part time station, the officers having other jobs which they can be called from. There is a 50' practice tower. The engine carries 20 hoses, most of which are 75'long, and 3 ladders of which the longest is 10.5ms. The engine carries about 400 gallons of water and has a maximum speed of 70mph though 40mph is considered a safe speed on the way to a fire.It has 6 equipment compartments and can carry 8 firemen though 6 is the normal number. The station receives about 200 calls a year most of which are local incidents, but the engine can be called out to fires over a wider area. Equipment is standard throughout the country. The helmets are made of cork and plastic.
